description: From urine +‎ -ate, from Medieval Latin urino, from Classical Latin ūrīna (“urine”). More at urea.

verbs.description: urinate (third-person singular simple present urinates, present participle urinating, simple past and past participle urinated)

entries.meaning: (urology) To pass urine from the body.
examples: Our new puppy still urinates on the carpet, but we're toilet-training her.
Boys on their campsite should avoid urinating within 200 feet of the lake.
